Author: Sir Seven#7158
Content:
@siu - Chainmakers 
Try curl from terminal:
`curl --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "2.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getinfo", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:7771/`
And check there is process listnening on 7771 port:
`ss -tlnp | grep 7771`

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @siu - Chainmakers ZEC is not compatible to be compiled on rasp pi, which is why KMD is not compat. It's not ever gonna happen

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so just get better hardware üôÇ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: 64bit OS is preferred, raspian is 32bit broken-ness

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @siu - Chainmakers the PirateChest uses this: https://store.pine64.org/?product=rockpro64-4gb-single-board-computer

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @dukeleto https://www.raspberrypi.org/products/raspberry-pi-3-model-b-plus/ has 64bit CPU, if I remember correct it's possible to compile komodod for x64 arm

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @siu - Chainmakers libnspv works on 32bit, but komodod wont. well i guess in nSPV=1 mode it might be possible to make it work, but would be a LOT of work and since libnspv already works, there seems little point

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL the flavor of ARM that it is doesn't play nice with zcash dependencies, iirc. There are very good reasons when radix42 says something ain't gonna work üôÇ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Unless you got it to actually work, I wouldn't assume

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: rasppi is ARMv7, i.e. many things are emulated in software or don't even exist, where ARMv8 is drastically better

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: rasp pi is just not worth the money, it's meant to be simple+easy with lots of "batteries included" stuff for students

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: It's not for dev'ing

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: additionally, the OS they give people to run on it, it's highly de-optimized

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: 32bit OS, for 64bit hardware, lulz

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://www.friendlyarm.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=234

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: That is what you want ^

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that has 6 cores, more than the pirate chest version

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and runs armbian nicely

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: not sure, but maybe AES primitives are missing on ARMv7

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: all i remember, is radix42 ran away screaming. Good luck üôÇ

Content: I think you will find that nobody has ever gotten Zcash running on any type of rasppi, if you do, let me know!

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: If it's not ARMv8, it's not worth working on the HW, imho

Author: Sir Seven#7158
Content:
Can you share your coins file entry for KMDICE?
Is it default?
```
  {
    "coin":"KMDICE",
    "asset":"KMDICE",
    "fname": "KMDice",
    "rpcport":30177,
    "mm2": 1
  },
```

Content:
With set above it defaults to KMD. And doesn't crash on loging.
```
./nspv KMDICE
couldnt match coin, defaulting to KMD chain
```
